Row.Text: Be it known that you are now in the land of the Celts. I am Boudicca, their chosen Queen. Do not underestimate me.
Well met, fellow warrior. I am Boudicca, leader of the Celtic peoples. May we be allies in this turbulent world.
Hail, foreign leader. I am Boudicca, Queen of the Celts, chosen of Prasutagus. In me lives the will of my people and the soul of a King.
Ah, I see you have more wits about you than the average man. I cede you this victory.
Be wary of contemptuous actions, lest you forget who you're dealing with.
Pray you do not anger me any further - my hounds have not hunted in quite some time.
Didn't you know that I was named for the goddess of Victory? Andraste's will is done today.
It appears that you are superior to your fellow kindred. I shall not underestimate you again.
You may have won our land and wealth, but my people are a proud one. Our legacy will live on, and be hard forgotten.
Vile ruler, know you have won this war in name alone. Your cities lie buried and your troops defeated. I have my own victory.
I take some small pleasure that it was you who bested my people on this field of battle. Another time, I would have proudly called you my peer.
Good day upon you.
Greetings.
Fare thee well.
Goodbye.
We are in agreement.
You will find that I am not some simple woman. You must improve your offer.
Can you do a little better?
That's not quite good enough.
Almost...
We are not interested. Leave.
You may have this bit of material wealth, yes. But such indiscretions are not easily forgotten.
What do you take me for, a fool?
I believe we can both benefit from a mutual sharing of goods.
We are willing to overlook your questionable deeds in return for fair compensation.
All right.
Very Well.
I must refuse.
No.
Let's hear it.
Go ahead.
Welcome.
Ah, it's good to see you again.
Until we meet again.
Farewell.
It is agreed.
In happier times I would heartily agree, but I'm afraid you will have to do a little better.
Come now, you'll need to improve your offer.
You're almost there...
Thank you, but we decline.
We are always ready to assist an ally in need.
Do not play upon our friendship and forget who you are dealing with.
Hardship is upon us, and we request your aid.
Let us join our forces together and reap the rewards.
Certainly.
I'm afraid not.
We decline.
Proceed.
I'm listening.
Oh, it's you.
What do you want?
That is all.
Go away now.
Agreed.
Even mad Nero wouldn't accept this offer. Improve it, or be gone.
That's not good enough.
You must do better than that.
Do you take me for a simpleton? Leave this place.
I see your impudence knows no bounds. This will not be easily forgiven.
Your senseless bleatings have fallen on deaf ears. Be gone, and waste not my time any further.
My loans are due, and I believe I should like to pay them with your gold instead of mine.
As much as I wish for your destruction, I believe we can set aside our differences for a small amount of time.
Ugh, very well.
A thousand times no.
That's unacceptable.
Never.
Continue, before I change my mind.
Our chariots are ready and the torches burn bright. My daughters shall know the taste of your blood!
The Great Hunt rides once more, but this time our target is not the lowly hare. I have been more than fair in giving you this warning - Run.
You shall stain this land no longer with your vileness! To arms, my countrymen. We ride to war!
Traitorous man! The Celtic peoples will not stand for such wanton abuse and slander - I shall have your head!
You dare?! Have you forgotten the price paid by Londinium? Your streets will ring with the battle cries of my people.
What treachery is this? By Andraste's might, the lamentation of your defeated peoples will be a sweet lullaby to my daughters' ears.
